page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF WOOLMER GREEN
page.content: There is a reference to the area,known as Mardley,as far back as the{Domesday {Book}.The population in{1981}was{1090. The village Church is St Michael's and is one of three in the Parish of Welwyn.There are five small shops in the village,two grocery shops,a butcher,a Post Office and a Pine furniture shop.There are three garages The largest is Lisles which has recently had a new forecourt. There are roughly{293}houses,flats and bungalows in the village.Many are council built. The old peoples bungalows were built 12 years ago. together with an OAP club.There are 3{Public houses},in the Village,the Fox is in New Rd.The Chequers and the Red Lion are on the South side of London Rd.The Pond has recently had an island been built in the middle by the school children.
